patterns: Tell about the departments in Tamilnadu
What are the departments available in Tamilnadu?
responses: Health and Family Welfare Department or School Education Departments

patterns: Schemes in Health and Family Welfare Department
Health and Family Welfare Department Schemes
What are the schemes available in Health and Family Welfare Department?
Schemes of Health and Family Welfare Department
responses: Janani Suraksha Yojana , Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram , Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme (MRMBS) , Girl child protection scheme

patterns: what is Janani Suraksha Yojana scheme?
responses: Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY) is a safe motherhood intervention scheme under the National Health Mission in India , It aims to reduce maternal and neonatal mortality by promoting institutional delivery among pregnant women, especially those who are poor and for more information visit https://www.nhm.tn.gov.in/en/nhm-programsrmncha/janani-shishu-suraksha-karyakram-jssk

patterns: who are Eligible for Janani Suraksha Yojana scheme?
responses: Pregnant women who fall below the poverty line, whether in rural or urban areas, are eligible for Janani Suraksha Yojana

patterns: Required documents for Janani Suraksha Yojana scheme
What are the documents required for Janani Suraksha Yojana scheme?
What are the documents required for JSY?
documents required for Janani Suraksha Yojana scheme
documents for Janani Suraksha Yojana scheme
responses: Required documents for JSY scheme is Aadhar card , Address Proof, Bank passbook , Janani Suraksha Yojana card

patterns: How to apply for Janani Suraksha Yojana scheme ?
apply for Janani Suraksha Yojana scheme
where to apply for Janani Suraksha Yojana scheme
responses: To apply for Janani Suraksha Yojana online by visiting the official website of JSY(https://nhm.gov.in/index1.php?lang=1&level=3&lid=309&sublinkid=841) or by visiting nearby public healthcare center , You will need to provide your RCH ID, category, applicant name, husband name, gender, Aadhaar number or virtual ID, date of birth, age, mobile number and other relevant information.

patterns: what are the benifits of Janani Suraksha Yojana scheme?
What are the benifits of JSY?
responses: Janani Suraksha Yojana provides cash assistance to eligible pregnant women who give birth in a government or accredited private health facility , The amount of financial assistance provided is Rs. 500/- per birth up to two live births for pregnant women who have attained 19 years of age and belong to the National Maternity Benefit Scheme (NMBS).

patterns: link to apply for Janani Suraksha Yojana scheme
More information about Janani Suraksha Yojana scheme
responses: visit https://nhm.gov.in/index1.php?lang=1&level=3&lid=309&sublinkid=841 to get more information about this scheme.

patterns: Tell about Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram scheme
what is Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram scheme?
About Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram scheme
responses: The Government of India introduced the Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram (JSSK) programme, which grants all expectant mothers giving birth in public health facilities the right to an entirely free delivery, including a Caesarean section and The programme intends to remove out-of-pocket costs that expectant mothers and unwell babies suffer when utilising services at public health institutions.

intents.tag: eligibility for Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram
patterns: Eligible for Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram
who are Eligible for Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram?
responses: Pregnant women who belong to below poverty line households and are at least 19 years old are eligible for the Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram and The scheme aims to benefit pregnant women who access government health facilities.

patterns: Required documents for  Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram scheme
What are the documents required for  Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram scheme?
What are the documents required for JSSK?
documents required for  Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram scheme
documents for  Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram scheme
responses: Required documents for JSSK scheme is Aadhar card , Address Proof, Bank passbook

patterns: How to apply for  Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram?
apply for Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram scheme
apply Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram scheme?
where to apply for Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram scheme
responses: To apply for Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram online by visiting the official website of JSSK(https://www.nhm.tn.gov.in/en/nhm-programsrmncha/janani-shishu-suraksha-karyakram-jssk) or by visiting nearby public health centers and You will need to provide your name, husband name, gender, Aadhaar number or virtual ID, date of birth, age, mobile number and other relevant information.

patterns: Benifits of Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram
what are the benifits of Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram scheme?
What are the benifits of JSSK?
responses: An initiative called Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram (JSSK) aims to offer pregnant women, caesarean patients, and unwell newborns (up to 30 days after birth) totally free and cashless care in government health facilities in both rural and urban areas , All pregnant women who give birth at public health facilities are entitled to completely free deliveries, including caesarean sections, free drugs and supplies, free diagnostics, free blood donation, exemption from user fees, and free transportation from their homes to the facility.

patterns: link to apply for Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram scheme
More information about Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram scheme
Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram scheme link
responses: Visit https://www.nhm.tn.gov.in/en/nhm-programsrmncha/janani-shishu-suraksha-karyakram-jssk to get more information about this scheme.

intents.tag: Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme (MRMBS)
patterns: Tell about Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme
what is Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme?
About Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme
Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme
responses: The Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme (MRMBS) is a programme that offers low-income expectant women cash support. The programme was renamed Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Program from National Maternity Benefit Scheme.

patterns: Eligible for Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme
Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme Eligibility
who are Eligible for Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme?
responses: \The pregnant mother should be of age 19 years and above , Should be a citizen of India and permanent resident of Tamil Nadu and Should have completed 19 yrs of age , The financial background of the pregnant woman should be below poverty line .

patterns: Required documents for Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme
What are the documents required for Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme?
What are the documents required for MRMBS?
documents required for Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme
documents for Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme
Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme documents
responses: Required documents for MRMBS is Aadhar card , Address Proof, Bank passbook ,Voter ID or Ration card.

patterns: How to apply for Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme?
apply for Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme
apply Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme ?
where to apply for Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme
responses: To apply for Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme, the pregnant mother should register her pregnancy before 12 weeks with the VHN / UHN or she should have pre-registration of pregnancy in PICME

patterns: Benifits of Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme
Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme
what are the benifits of Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme?
What are the benifits of MRMBS?
responses: Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme provides financial assistance to poor pregnant mothers in India In accordance with the terms of the G.O.(Ms) No. 184 dated on 11.09, impoverished pregnant women are eligible to receive Rs. 1000/month for 6 months starting in the seventh month of pregnancy.

patterns: link to apply for Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme
More information about Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme
Dr. Muthulakshmi Reddy Maternity Benefit Scheme link
responses: Visit https://krishnagiri.nic.in/scheme/dr-muthulakshmi-maternity-benefit-scheme/ to get more information about this scheme.

patterns: Tell about Girl child protection scheme
what is Girl child protection scheme?
responses: The Chief Minister's Girl Child Protection Scheme is aimed at preventing gender discrimination by empowering and protecting the rights of girl children through direct investment from the government and The Scheme's objectives are to increase girl students enrollment and attendance in school and to guarantee that they complete at least an intermediate level of education.

intents.tag: eligibility for Girl child protection scheme
patterns: Eligible for Girl child protection scheme
CM'S Girl child protection scheme Eligibility
who are eligible for Girl child protection scheme?
who are all eligible for Girl child protection scheme?
responses: \To be eligible for Chief Minister's Girl Child Protection Scheme, The girl child should appear for 10th standard public examination , The family should have two female child and no male child , The girl child must be enrolled in an educational institution

intents.tag: Required documents for Girl child protection scheme
patterns: Required documents for Girl child protection scheme
What are the documents required for Girl child protection scheme?
documents required for Girl child protection scheme
documents for Girl child protection scheme
responses: Aadhar card , Bank passbook , Ration card , income certificate , Age certificate , Nativity Certificate

intents.tag: Apply for Girl child protection scheme
patterns: How to apply for Girl child protection scheme?
apply for Girl child protection scheme
where to apply for Girl child protection scheme?
responses: To apply for Chief Minister's Girl Child Protection Scheme, citizens can apply through eSeva or visit the district social welfare office and Applicants should apply with relevant documents such as Income Certificate, Nativity Certificate, No male child Certificate, Birth Certificate of Girl Childrens

intents.tag: Benefits of Girl child protection scheme
patterns: Benifits of Girl child protection scheme
what are the benifits of Girl child protection scheme?
responses: The Chief Minister's Girl Child Protection Program strives to ensure that all girls receive an education that is at least at the intermediate level and to encourage their enrollment and retention in school and The programme urges girls to wait until they are 18 years old before getting married.

intents.tag: link for Girl child protection scheme
patterns: More information about Girl child protection scheme
responses: https://chennai.nic.in/old-welfare/
